intro: Trisetopsis milanjiana, commonly known as the Milanjian's trisetopsis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
